args: All better now, thanks to Cleo.
Great! Now ya just gotta scarf down\ntons of healthy grub, and ya'll be\nback to normal in no time flat.
Speaking of which, how about an apple?\nI've got some real juicy ones here.
I am grateful for all of your concern.
The other day, you went up against\nthe Divine Torch on your own.

After that, you put yourself in harm's way
in order to protect a child. And while any
of us would have done the same, you did
so in a terribly reckless fashion.

There's something burning inside you that
makes you forget basic tactics and
common sense while on the battlefield.
What is it? What's going on?
You don't have to talk to me if you don't\nwant to, but I'm always ready to listen.
No, it's all right. I made trouble for you,\nand owe you an explanation.
My home kingdom of Nifl was devastated\nby the nation of Múspell.
They bathed our kingdom of ice in a\nwall of flame, leaving nothing in their\nwake but destruction.

The queen—my mother—fought valiantly
against them, but eventually succumbed
to the forces of flame. She was killed
right before my eyes.
So when you saw the awful things\nthe Divine Torch was doing...
I snapped. That village became my own,\nand I could no longer see reason.
I hate them with every fiber of my being,\nand everything just went...red.
Hell, if I saw a buncha folks burnin'\na village right after mine went up\nin flames, I'd probably lose it too.
But is hate the only cause?
If it was mere hate that drove you to fight,\nyou wouldn't have thought to save a child.
There must be some other reason.\nCan you tell us what it is?
Something even stronger than hate\nhas my heart twisted about itself.
It is...shame. Shame at my powerlessness,\nand the fact I could do nothing but run\nas my home and people burned.
And you're trying to shed that sense of\npowerlessness by putting yourself in\ndanger for the sake of others?
When I'm working to help someone else,\nit makes me feel...essential.
Pardon me for the intrusion, but there is\na woman who came here hoping to speak\nwith you, {player_name}.
You saved him the other day, Lady Fjorm.
Why do you ask? Did something happen?
I haven't seen him since this morning.\nI know he was quite worried about Lady\nFjorm, so I thought he might be here.
Oh no... He must have gone for the herbs!\nOh, whatever am I to do?!
A medicinal herb used in the treatment of\nburns grows in the bog near our village.
That bog's just a stone's throw away.\nIs he really not back yet?

Though close, the bog has some
dangerously deep spots, and if one
goes far enough into the area, there
are even fiend nests!
That ain't no place for a kid!
This is my fault. I must go after him!
Wait, Fjorm! Don't run off alone!
...I can't believe she did it again.\nDoes she see herself in the child?
We can't let her do this on her own.
I know. Come on, everyone! After her!
Fjorm, you HAVE to stop running off!\nWe're happy to help you look for the child\nif you'll just wait for five seconds.
The child ran into this bog because of me.\nIt is my duty to find him!
Blaming yourself for this situation\nisn't going to solve anything.
Furthermore, it's only BECAUSE of you\nthat he's alive to begin with.
And yet, if I were stronger, I wouldn't have\ntaken an injury and we would not be in\nthis situation now.
That's absurd. If anything, your great\nstrength ALLOWS you to be reckless.

You take risks another person wouldn't
because your strength allows it to all
work out in the end. And when the boy
saw that, he may have thought the same.
Have I truly set him on such a path...?
Don't be hard on yourself—it's a lesson\nI've had to learn myself countless times.

Heck, I STILL do it. I see someone I care
about in trouble, and think that if I can
just save them, it makes any personal
sacrifice acceptable no matter the cost.
But you lead the Halidom! If you fall,\nyour nascent kingdom falls with you!
Oh, I know. It's a trait I can easily see\nin others, but one I have a hard time\nrecognizing in myself.

But what I've learned is this: Instead of
SACRIFICING yourself to help someone,
it's better to lean on your allies and help
the person together. Do you understand?
I had not thought of it in quite\nthat way before...
So don't run off every time you see a\nproblem to be solved. Instead, lend your\nstrength to us and we'll solve it together.
It would seem I have been less of a\nsavior, and more of a stubborn fool.
Right then. Let us go find the boy.\nI know we can do it if we work together!
Just in the nick of time.
Hey! What are you doing here, ma'am?!
Your mother was very worried because you\ncame to this dangerous place all alone,\nso I came to look for you.
I know why you came here.\nI know it was because of me.
But you mustn't worry your mother\nand everyone like that ever again.
I'm sorry! I just wanted to make up\nfor you getting hurt!
I thought I could make it all better\nif I found the herbs... I knew it was\ndangerous but... Urgh. I'm sorry.
I'm happy you felt that way. Thank you.
But even so, it makes us all sad when we\nthink of the danger you put yourself in.
Your life is precious, and you must\ntreat it as such.
And I promise not to do anything that\nmakes you worry ever again.
